Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Sure, can I ask who's calling? Just a second.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Jim Halpert. What? How did you get this number? Stalker.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Katy and Jim met in the office. And now I guess they're like going out, or dating, or something. And, uh... I don't know! You know? They're just... She calls him, and they... You know, I'm sorry. I feel like I'm talking really loud. Am I talking really loud?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So we're still on for lunch? You're meeting me here? Okay. Great. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Hey! You can just give her your extension.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Howard, slash Ryan, Ryan Howard is sitting in my office. And he has been a temp here for a couple of months and he's kind of gotten the lay of the land a little bit. Had a few laughs along the way. And now he wants to know what I think.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: The temp agency wants to know what you think.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shall we? Let us proceed. First up, proficiency in necessary skills. Aaaaeeexcellent! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael's in there right now evaluating the temp. He hasn't evaluated me in years.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Five years from now, what do you want to do? Where do you want to be?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ah, well, I'm interested in business.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Good. Ambitious. Excellent. Want to be a manager?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, no, actually, uh, what I want is to own my own company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan's about to attend the Michael Scott School of Business. I'm like Mr. Miyagi and Yoda rolled into one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [speaks in a Yoda voice] Much advice you seek. [regular voice] Do you know who that is?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Fozzie bear?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm... No. That was Yoda.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There are ten rules of business that you need to learn. Number one:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] [makes clicking noises like shooting a gun] Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael and I have a very special connection. He's like Batman, I'm like Robin. He's like the Lone Ranger, and I'm like Tonto. And it's not like there was the Lone Ranger, and Tonto, and Bonto.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [in background, on phone] But it says no late fee... .

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [alarm sounds] People!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay! Everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is not a test! Move to the exits!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do not panic!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Head towards the exits.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Safety partners.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get up off your desks!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do not panic.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [in phone] No, I don't hear it? Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, panic is warranted!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Go in single file lines.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [in phone] No, no. Finish the...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is not at drill!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Arms at your sides! Arms at your sides!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please, move quickly! This is a paper company, people! Step lively!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Go, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This whole place is a tinder box, it is ready to blow!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is not a test! Can you leave?!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, you say that every time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: DO YOU WANT TO DIE?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, boy...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you want to die? OUT!!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Alright, let's go, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: STANLEY! Have you ever seen a burn victim?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Come on, you're safety partners!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Move to the exits!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You're safety partners!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We've got smoke! We've got smoke! Smoke! Gah! [Spots Kelly] Oh, Kelly! You're okay! I've got you!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm okay!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cover your nose and mouth. Breathe through your nose.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Let go of me!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Breathe through your nose. Remove your stockings. Okay? They'll melt right into your flesh! Stay below the smoke line. Let's go! Clear out, stat! STAT MEANS NOW!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I was the first one out. And, yes, I've heard women and children first. But, we do not employ children. We are not a sweat shop. Thankfully. And, uh, women are equal in the workplace by law. So, I let them out first, I have a lawsuit on my hands.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Another rule of business is being able to adapt to different situations.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Adapt. React. Re-adapt. Act. All right? That's rule number two.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, guys, listen up, we need a head count. We need to count off. Michael's number one. Where is he? Where is he?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So what was rule two?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ah... adapt, react, re-adapt, act.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, let's... . let's kind of take it a little slower.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael. Um... Ryan needs his number for the count off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, uh, well, one is taken.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, okay, two?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: NO!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay... uh, sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, he can have 14. Marjory's not here today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, he needs a permanent number, right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: ...I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, you know what else? I thought of a nickname for the three of us. Three Musketeers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, yeah. Okay. That... No, no, no. I got one. I got one. The Three Stooges.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's funny, too. But if we're the Three Musketeers...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't want to be like "a guy" here. You know? Like, Stanley is the "crossword puzzle guy". And Angela has cats. I don't want to have a thing... here. You know, I don't want to be the "something guy".

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what? I am going to be, uh, setting the agenda here. Okay? Can everybody gather up, please? Important announcement. Very important announcement. I think this is a perfect opportunity for all of us to participate in some really intense, psychologically revealing conversations. So we're going to be playing Desert Island, umm, Who Would You Do?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And, um...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...Would You Rather?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Would You Rather. Would You Rather is our third game.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to firemen] Hey guys, great response time. Listen up, I got some theories. Okay, there's a...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so... three books on a desert island? Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The Bible.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's one book. You've got two others.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: A Purpose Driven Life.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice. Third book?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Um, The DaVinci Code.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The DaVinci Code!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I would take The DaVinci Code... so I could burn The DaVinci Code.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Great, that's going to keep you warm for like 7 seconds. Question:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Rule number four. In business, image is everything - Andre Agassi. This car is an investment. Right? If I have to take out a client or I'm seen around Scranton in it. I love it. I love this car. Do you like it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Thought people read more books.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: DVDs! Five movies. What would you bring to the island? Yes! Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Legends of the Fall, My Big Fat Greek Wedding, Legally Blond, Bridges of Madison County...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Legends of the Fall?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Bridges of Madison County, Legally Blond, these movies are just... .

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I kind of liked Legal...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, wait. Pam. No. Do you understand? The... the game is Desert Island Movies, not guilty pleasure movies. Desert Island Movies are the movies you're going to watch for the rest of your life! Forever! Unforgivable.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I take it back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Unforgivable.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I take it back!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: ...and Ghost. But, ah, just that one scene...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is this your car, Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, some pretty big books back there, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Don't...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good shocks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Mr. Egghead! Woop! So... oh, Stanley Kaplan! I know him. 'M' is for Murder, 'P' is for...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's actually a test prep book.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...for Phone. What?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's a test prep for business school.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, oh, thinking about business school?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I just got in. I applied, I go at night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you think you know a lot about business?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, not yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Just started.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Quiz me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I... wouldn't even know where to start.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, egghead. Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Quiz me up.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: All right, um... Why have people been rethinking the Microsoft model in the past few years?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I was Ryan's age, I worked in a fast food restaurant, to save up money for school. And then I spe... lost it in a pyramid scheme. But I learned more about business, right then and there, than business school would ever teach me, or Ryan would ever teach me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Is it cheaper to sign a new customer? Or to keep an existing customer?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Keep an existing...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Shut, it. Can I... can I just do it please? [to Ryan] Uh, it's equal.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It is ten times more expensive to sign a new customer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Yes! It was a trick question.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, but look, I mean, he didn't need business school. Okay, Michael comes from the school of hard knocks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Self taught. You didn't even go to college.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, Dwight? You don't need to help me here. Okay? Well, you know... Maybe you should go to business school like Ryan, then... then you'd know what you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] Come on. I'm studying with the master, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: For instance, why don't you go to business...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] You should learn from him, right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I am.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I am.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop. Dwight. You know what? You're acting like a dork. Would you cool it? Please. Okay. Hey! He's not your five year old brother, Dwight. He's a valued member of this company... and you know what? He knows more about business than you ever will.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stupid!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did not go to business school. You know who else didn't go to business school? LeBron James, Tracy McGrady, Kobe Bryant. They went right from high school to the NBA. So... so it's not the same thing. At all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at this stuff. Market fragments. What is that supposed to be?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's a way of looking at consumers as subsets of a larger client base.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are so smart. You are so eff-in' smart. You should be teaching me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam? Get us back into it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Five movies. Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, Fargo, um, Edward Scissorhands, Dazed and Confused...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh, definitely in my top five.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. In my top three, so suck it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Breakfast Club. Um... The Princess Bride and...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay that's five.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, my all time favorite!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, play by the rules.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: All time favorite.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Play by the rules. Dwight. All time favorite movie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Crow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I became a salesman... because of people, I love making friends. But then I was promoted to manager, at a very young age. I still try to be a friend first, but... You know? I'm very successful... your coworkers look at you differently. Huu, what do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Maybe we should get some air.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nah, I'm okay.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm really uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. Let's move on. Let's move on to the main event. Who Would You Do?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Present company excluded?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, not neccessari...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... okay. Ah, you know what? Maybe I'll... I'll finish explaining the rules. Let's... let me explain it first, and then...

Quote.Speaker: song
Quote.Text: ["Everybody Hurts" by R.E.M.] Think you've had too much / in this life.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, so we'll get right... You know what? I'll be right back. Stanley, you're taking over for me, buddy. I'll be right back.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Okay, um...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight. Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Song
Quote.Text: Everybody hurts,

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on Dwight! Use words.

Quote.Speaker: Song
Quote.Text: Sometim... .

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why didn't I go to business school?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who goes to business school?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The temp.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He does?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's all him and Michael talk about anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, I bet Ryan thinks to himself 'I wish I were a volunteer sheriff on the weekends'.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He doesn't even know that I do that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You should tell him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, Pam. Right. That's going to help things, just talk it out. I hope the war goes on forever and Ryan gets drafted.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry I said that, I didn't... just part of me meant it. Besides, he'd end up being a hero anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what you should do? You should quit. And then, that would stick it to both of them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh Jim, I'm not going to quit. Then Ryan wins.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. You're right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks you guys. I just need some alone time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Song
Quote.Text: Everybody hurts

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Song
Quote.Text: Everybody cries

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey! Guys, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Song
Quote.Text: Everybody hurts

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What's up? Can I hang out with you guys for a bit?

Quote.Speaker: Song
Quote.Text: Sometimes

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: The warehouse guys are a bunch of jackasses sometimes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Come on people, you know the rules of the game now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey. Game, what game are we playing here?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Okay. It's called Who Would You Do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I play this at home all the time while I'm falling asleep. What, uh... . Where are we? Where are we here? Mmm.. Roy? Roy? Who would you do, Roy?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Uh... Oh, I got it! Uh, what's the name of that, uh, tight ass, uh, Christian, uh, chick. The, uh, the blond?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: My name is Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, Angela! Roy. Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aaaall right. Who's next, who's next, who's next, who's? Jim? You're next. Who would you do?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... Kevin, hands down. Yeah. He's really got that teddy bear thing going on, and afterwards, we could just watch bowling.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I would definitely have sex with Ryan. 'Cause he is going to own his own business.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You're all gay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's, uh... Who's next? Who we got? Whooo...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [answers phone] Hey, no, I can talk, I can talk, I can talk... this is great timing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wish I had my cell phone, but I left it inside. So...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Would that make you happy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you had your cell phone, it would make you happy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm on it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight. Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You can't go in yet!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, don't! He is an idiot. The man is an idiot, ladies and gentlemen.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What if he dies in the fire? And that's the last thing you ever said to him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't say it to him. I said it about him.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: ...Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Definitely Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Definitely, definitely, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Come on, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: How about you Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... Oscar's kind of cute.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, I like Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ooh, Toby!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the background] How long does it take to find a cell phone? I don't know either.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Is there anybody else.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [clears his throat]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Hey, where are you? Oh good. Yeah. We're just here, we're playing Desert Island. It's when you pick your five favorite DVDs...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Seriously, where the hell is Dwight? Hey, call my cell phone. It'll make it easier for him to find.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's your number?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I gave it to you in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I saw you program it in.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You got to... you got to give it to me again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Now I have it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, I better tell somebody. [to fireman] Excuse me, sir...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [coughing]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight!? Great goin'. God, Man! Why did you go in there? What... Everybody was scared out of their wits, man? Oooh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [coughing] Everyone, okay? Uh, I have an announcement. Apparently, in business school, they don't teach you how to operate a toaster oven. Because some smart, sexy temp left his cheese pita on oven instead of timing it for the toaster thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Okay. Well, I guess they don't teach how to operate a toaster oven in business school.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's exactly what I said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, did you miss that day there, Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Were you absent?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toaster Oven 101?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You failed?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I am so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! I know what'll impress everybody, I'll start a fire. Oh, man. Bad idea. Bad idea jeans.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have a song. Attention, everyone! That I want to sing. That I wrote especially for this occasion when I was up there among the flames. Ready? [sings to Billy Joel's "We Didn't Start the Fire"] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning since the world's been turning!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight and Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] ...since the world was turning.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can't believe I started the fire.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight and Michael
Quote.Text: [sing gibberish to "We Didn't Start the Fire"]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] ... Marilyn Monroe!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight and Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Ryan started the fire! It was always burning...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eat it! You gotta eat it. You have to eat it!

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Hi!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I'm good. It's good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good to see you, too.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: I'm hungry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I am too.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Oh, I have been thinking the whole way over and I have my answers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What answers?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Um, for the... the desert island.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh! Right! Right, right, right, come-ah on, on, on. [to everyone] Ladies and gentlemen! Gather around! We have one more participant. Come on, be polite. Be polite. [to Katy] Desert Island. Five movies. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Okay, um, first, Legally Blond.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I forgot what a super, nice girl Katy is. And just... good for Jim! They are so cute together. And, um, what an adorable car.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I think the game's over... People are like leaving. There was a bigger crowd last time. Do you just want to go to lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Alright! You want to drive?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Katy
Quote.Text: [looking at Roy and Pam] They are soo cute.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm really sorry, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Answer me this, though.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Was it worth it? Was it worth it temp?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Was it worth it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm really sorry, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The fire guy! The fire guy!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sings] Joe McCarthy, Richard Nixon, Studebaker, television, North Korea, South Korea, Marilyn Monroe, Ryan started the fire!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Rule five - safety first, i.e. don't burn the building down. Okay? That should be a no brainer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... look! Ryan is book smart. And I am street smart. And book smart.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll give you the rest of the ten tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Seventy and clear, that's nice. Where's that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm Michael's number two. He's one, I'm two. He's Alpha, I'm Beta. He's A, I'm B. It's easy. Whatever Michael is, I'm one less.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Rule three: Reach for the stars. And if you fail, see rule four. Rule four:

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know Michael's every move. It's not something you can just pick up. I could write a book about him. Literally. I started once, but Michael made me stop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, how's it going, man?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Good. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, nothing much. What's up with you?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm good, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good. Good, I'm good, too. How's it cracking?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, fine. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what you would love? Guns N' Roses. When I was your age, I loved Guns N' Roses. Do you like Guns N' Roses? I'll make you a tape.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll make you two tapes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't have a tape player. So...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Someday, temp. I've got a couple of shirts that don't fit so well anymore. I'll bring them by. Okay, see you later.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael and I have a very special connection, like an umbilical cord. And the thing is with Ryan is that I don't want him to trip on it, or get it caught around his neck.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Sixty-three, sixty-four, sixty-five, sixty-six, sixty-seven, sixty-eight. [snickering] Sixty-nine. Seventy. Seventy-one, seventy-two, seventy-three.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I like fire drills. You know what's the greatest? Like, when you were in school and the teacher would let you have class outside.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, the best.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, it was great because it was like you're supposed to be working, but nothing ever gets done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, we had outside classes all the time and we never did anything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [chuckling]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually if I had fewer outside classes, I probably wouldn't be stuck here at a paper company.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're not stuck.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, there is a real fire, but it's okay. Everyone got out fine. This is why you practice these things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, yes, I ran out first. A captain is always the first one on the ship and the last one off the ship. And this parking lot is our ship when the building is on fire. So, I ran out onto the ship.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, DVDs. Five movies. What would you bring to the island? Toby, go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Say Anything, The Shining, Annie Hall, that's too obvious.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Those are like my favorite movies. I didn't really think you could win Desert Island, but I think you just did.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Toy Story 2, one of the best movies I ever saw. I went for my daughter and stayed because you can't leave your daughter in a theater.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Toby and I used to sit together until Michael moved us because he thought we talked too much.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Kevin, do it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Uh, Cannonball Run, Cannonball Run II, [snickering] Weekend at Bernie's, Weekend at Bernie's II, and, oh, Groundhog Day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Groundhog Day.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I have a client who watches that movie once a week, at least.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I should put you in touch with him. Maybe we could get together and work on that account.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I would love that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, guys, guys, guys. That almost sounded like business, and we are trying to focus here today, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I was Ryan's age, I worked at Arby's and then I worked selling cutlery for a while. Cutlery that could decimate a penny, I kid you not. There were these shears that could cut straight through a penny. So I have life experience and work experience that Ryan doesn't, and will never have.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And then you go to school for three years.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: For two years, and it's only at night, and then it's on your resume forever.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. And just out of curiosity, how much is it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: $650 bucks

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A semester?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: A credit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's an investment.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, it sounds like it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I think it's worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If I could change the life of one person, just one person. I... Actually, that's shooting kind of low. I already did that when I was born. I changed two people's lives. Mom and Dad. Um, if I could change the lives of 5,000 people... 10,000. No, five. I'd be satisfied with 5,000. I... 10,000 though, that'd be something. Wow, 10,000 people. Because, you know what? Even one is amazing.
